unnormalised: **New Wheels Hit Indian Roads – Buckle Up, Folks!**
normalised: New Wheels Hit Indian Roads – Buckle Up, Folks!

unnormalised: The automotive scene is buzzing like a Delhi auto rickshaw at rush hour! Several manufacturers have unleashed their latest creations onto the Indian market. Dr. Reddy, lead designer at Mahindra, proudly unveiled the new "Scorpio N Extreme" edition near Nashik, promising enhanced off-roading capabilities. They are claiming better mileage than your chacha’s old Ambassador.
normalised: The automotive scene is buzzing like a Delhi auto rickshaw at rush hour! Several manufacturers have unleashed their latest creations onto the Indian market. Doctor Reddy, lead designer at Mahindra, proudly unveiled the new "Scorpio N Extreme" edition near Nashik, promising enhanced off-roading capabilities. They are claiming better mileage than your chacha’s old Ambassador.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Tata Motors launched the "Nexon i-Turbo CNG," aiming to woo the eco-conscious crowd. With CNG prices still lower than petrol, it seems like a smart move, bhai!
normalised: Meanwhile, Tata Motors launched the "Nexon i-Turbo C N G," aiming to woo the eco-conscious crowd. With C N G prices still lower than petrol, it seems like a smart move, bhai!

unnormalised: Not to be left behind, Maruti Suzuki has teased a "Jimny 5-door" variant, expected to launch around Diwali. Speculations are rife about its price point; some say it will start at Rs. 10 lakhs.
normalised: Not to be left behind, Maruti Suzuki has teased a "Jimny five-door" variant, expected to launch around Diwali. Speculations are rife about its price point; some say it will start at rupee ten lakhs.

unnormalised: And for the luxury segment, Mercedes-Benz India showcased its expansive showroom in Bangalore, boasting over 5,000 sq ft of display area. They say they're prepping for launch of the updated S-Class, which will set you back a cool Rs. 2 crore. Keep your eyes peeled and wallets ready!
normalised: And for the luxury segment, Mercedes-Benz India showcased its expansive showroom in Bangalore, boasting over five thousand square feet of display area. They say they're prepping for launch of the updated S-Class, which will set you back a cool rupee two crore. Keep your eyes peeled and wallets ready!
